title: Quick Shoot Production from Sweet Potato

tasks.task: Prepare and propagate sweet potato shoots using water cups
subtasks: Collect sweet potato samples (three varieties: yellow, purple, and white)
Prepare plastic cups with water
Clean and segment the sweet potatoes into two portions
Insert toothpicks into each segment for stabilization
Place segments into water cups, maintaining proper water levels
Wait 2 weeks for shoots to develop
Carefully remove shoots once they reach 8-10 cm in length
Re-dip shoots into new water cups for root development
Monitor new roots for 1 week before transplanting

tasks.task: Transplant developed shoots into main field or desired media
subtasks: Ensure proper spacing and environmental conditions for transplantation success

tasks.task: Prepare and propagate sweet potato shoots using water cups
subtasks: Collect three sweet potato varieties (yellow, purple, white)
Prepare plastic cups with water
Slice sweet potatoes into halves
Insert toothpicks into each sliced sweet potato
Place sliced sweet potatoes into cups with water, ensuring water levels are correct
Wait two weeks for shoots to develop
Carefully remove shoots once they reach 8-10 cm
Replant shoots into new cups for root development (using toothpicks again?)
Allow new roots to develop for one week

tasks.task: Transplant developed shoots into the main field

Wait, but when they did the first step, after the shoots are grown, they separate the shoots, right? So maybe "Replant separated shoots into new water cups for rooting." Then once rooted, they can be transplanted. So the last MAINTASK would be "Transplant developed shoots into main field or desired location."
Prepare and propagate sweet potato shoots using water cups

But the speaker mentions that once you have the shoots, after a week of rooting, you can transplant them. So maybe steps 5-7 would occur, then steps after that. Wait, perhaps step 6 is after shoots are grown, then step 7 is dipping them into new water for rooting, and then step 8 is allowing them to regrow roots. Then finally step 9. So maybe multiple MAINTASKS?
Prepare and propagate sweet potato shoots using water cups
Collect and prepare sweet potatoes for shoot production
subtasks: Go to a shopping mall to collect three types of sweet potatoes (黄色、紫色、白色).

tasks.task: Set up cups and water for sweet potato shoot production.
subtasks: Prepare three plastic cups.
Fill cups with tap water.
Wash and dry the sweet potatoes.
Cut the sweet potatoes into two halves each.
Insert a toothpick into each half (three toothpicks if three cups).
Position the halves horizontally in the cups with the cut side down, toothpick holding the vertical position.
Wait approximately two weeks for the shoots to develop.

tasks.task: Remove and re-root shoots for further growth.
subtasks: Identify shoots that have reached 8-10 cm.
Carefully remove shoots from their cups.
Dip each shoot into a new cup with water.
Place shoots in new cups with toothpicks to hold them, ensuring water is about 1 cm deep.
Wait one week for shoots to develop roots in the new cups.

tasks.task: Prepare and propagate sweet potato shoots using water cups
Prepare and propagate sweet potato shoots using water cups
Transplant developed shoots into the main field
